channel.title: nlin.SI updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: nlin.SI updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Entwining tetrahedron maps
item.description: arXiv:2410.06888v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We present three non-equivalent procedures to obtain entwining (non-constant) tetrahedron maps. Given a tetrahedron map, the first procedure incorporates its underlying symmetry group. With the second procedure we obtain several classes of entwining tetrahedron maps by considering certain compositions of pentagon with reverse-pentagon maps which satisfy certain compatibility relations the so-called ten-term relations. Using the third procedure, provided that a given tetrahedron map admits at least one companion map (partial inverse), we obtain entwining set theoretical solutions of the tetrahedron equation.
item.dc:creator: Pavlos Kassotakis

item.title: Nonlinear steepest descent on a torus: A case study of the Landau-Lifshitz equation
item.description: arXiv:2405.17662v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We obtain rigorous large time asymptotics for the Landau-Lifshitz equation in the soliton free case by extending the nonlinear steepest descent method to genus 1 surfaces. The methods presented in this paper pave the way to a rigorous analysis of other integrable equations on the torus and enable asymptotic analysis on different regimes of the Landau-Lifshitz equation.
item.dc:creator: Harini Desiraju, Alexander R. Its, Andrei Prokhorov
